intro: Baccharis tenuiptera, commonly known as shrub baccharis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in heads, typical of the daisy family. It is often found in coastal areas and can tolerate saline conditions, making it adaptable to various environments. Its aromatic leaves and ornamental value make it a popular choice for landscaping in suitable climates.
